title: Key Signatures
description: Understand key signatures and the circle of fifths for sharp keys.

steps.title: What is a Key Signature?
steps.description: A key signature tells you which notes are sharp or flat throughout a piece of music. Instead of writing a sharp or flat on every note, the key signature puts them at the beginning. For example, the key of G has one sharp (F#), so every F in the piece is played as F#.

steps.title: The Circle of Fifths (Sharp Keys)
steps.description:
Starting from C (no sharps), each step up by a perfect 5th adds one sharp:

• C major: 0 sharps
• G major: 1 sharp (F#)
• D major: 2 sharps (F#, C#)
• A major: 3 sharps (F#, C#, G#)
• E major: 4 sharps (F#, C#, G#, D#)

The sharps always appear in the same order: F#, C#, G#, D#, A#, E#, B#

steps.title: C Major: No Sharps
steps.description: Play C major — the key with no sharps or flats. All white keys.

steps.title: G Major: 1 Sharp
steps.description: Play G major — one sharp (F#). Going up a 5th from C gives us G.

steps.title: D Major: 2 Sharps
steps.description: Play D major — two sharps (F# and C#). Another 5th up from G.
